Activity: Log in to the system, check emails and company announcements. Grab a cup of coffee and mentally prepare for the week. Briefly review the goals for this week: wireframes, mockups, prototyping, visual design, and user testing.

Research and gather inspiration. Browse UI designs from other successful third-person shooters, paying attention to their main menu, HUD, inventory, and settings screens. Dribbble and Behance are good starting points.
Start sketching wireframes for the main menu. Consider different layout options for accessing game modes, settings, player profiles, and the in-game store.
Refine the main menu wireframes and begin creating digital wireframes using Figma. Focus on the placement of elements and user flow, not visual details.
Begin working on wireframes for the in-game HUD. Consider the essential information players need: health, ammo, minimap, objectives, and cooldowns.
Email @LVDN-1, @LDES-1 to clarify which in-game information is most critical for the HUD design, ensuring alignment with gameplay priorities. Subject: HUD Information Priorities.
Continue refining the HUD wireframes based on feedback received. Explore different layouts for optimal readability and accessibility.
Review the progress of the day, document key decisions, and plan for tomorrow's tasks. Start preparing a basic style guide by gathering inspiration for typography and color palettes.
